fields.name: RAMP_EN
fields.description: Control frequency ramping mode.

fields.name: VCO_PHASE_SYNC
fields.description: Control phase synchronization.

fields.name: OUT_MUTE
fields.description: Mute the outputs when the VCO is calibrating.

values.name: DISABLED
values.description: Disabled. If disabled, also be sure to enable OUT_FORCE

values.name: ENABLED
values.description: Enabled. If enabled, also be sure to disable OUT_FORCE

fields.name: FCAL_HPFD_ADJ
fields.description: Set this field in accordance to the phase-detector frequency for optimal VCO calibration.

fields.name: FCAL_LPFD_ADJ
fields.description: Set this field in accordance to the phase detector frequency for optimal VCO calibration.

fields.name: FCAL_EN
fields.description: Enable the VCO frequency calibration. Also note that the action of programming this bit to a 1 activates the VCO calibration

fields.name: MUXOUT_LD_SEL
fields.description: Selects the state of the function of the MUXout pin

fields.name: RESET
fields.description: Resets and holds all state machines and registers to default value.

fields.name: POWERDOWN
fields.description: Powers down entire device

fields.name: CAL_CLK_DIV
fields.description: Sets divider for VCO calibration state machine clock based on input frequency. If user is not concerned with lock time, it is recommended to set this value to 3. By slowing down the VCO calibration, the best and most repeatable VCO phase noise can be attained.

values.name: DIVIDE_BY_1
values.description: Divide by 1. Use for fOSC ≤ 200 MHz

values.name: DIVIDE_BY_2
values.description: Divide by 2. Use for fOSC ≤ 400 MHz

values.name: DIVIDE_BY_4
values.description: Divide by 4. Use for fOSC ≤ 800 MHz

fields.name: ACAL_CMP_DLY
fields.description: VCO amplitude calibration delay. Lowering this value can speed up VCO calibration, but lowering it too much may degrade VCO phase noise. The minimum allowable value for this field is 10 and this allows the VCO to calibrate to the correct frequency for all scenarios. To yield the best and most repeatable VCO phase noise, this relationship should be met: ACAL_CMP_DLY > Fsmclk / 10 MHz, where Fsmclk = Fosc / 2^(CAL_CLK_DIV) and Fosc is the input reference frequency. If calibration time is of concern, then it is recommended to set this register to ≥ 25.

fields.name: OUT_FORCE
fields.description: Works with OUT_MUTE in disabling outputs when VCO calibrating.

fields.name: VCO_DACISET_FORCE
fields.description: This forces the VCO_DACISET value

fields.name: VCO_CAPCTRL_FORCE
fields.description: This forces the VCO_CAPCTRL value

fields.name: OSC_2X
fields.description: Low noise OSCin frequency doubler.

fields.name: MULT
fields.description: Programmable input frequency multiplier 0,2,,8-31: Reserved, 1: Byapss, 3: 3X ... 7: 7X

fields.name: PLL_R
fields.description: Programmable input path divider after the programmable input frequency multiplier.

fields.name: PLL_R_PRE
fields.description: Programmable input path divider before the programmable input frequency multiplier.

fields.name: CPG
fields.description: Effective charge-pump current. This is the sum of up and down currents.

fields.name: VCO_DACISET
fields.description: This sets the final amplitude for the VCO calibration in the case that amplitude calibration is forced.

fields.name: VCO_DACISET_STRT
fields.description: This sets the initial starting point for the VCO amplitude calibration.

fields.name: VCO_CAPCTRL
fields.description: This sets the final VCO band when VCO_CAPCTRL is forced.

fields.name: VCO_SEL
fields.description: This sets VCO start core for calibration and the VCO when it is forced.

fields.name: VCO_SEL_FORCE
fields.description: This forces the VCO to use the core specified by VCO_SEL. It is intended mainly for diagnostic purposes.

fields.name: CHDIV_DIV2
fields.description: Enable driver buffer for CHDIV > 2

fields.name: PLL_N[18:16]
fields.description: The PLL_N divider value is in the feedback path and divides the VCO frequency.

fields.name: PLL_N[15:0]
fields.description: The PLL_N divider value is in the feedback path and divides the VCO frequency.

fields.name: MASH_SEED_EN
fields.description: Enabling this bit allows the to be applied to shift the phase at the output or optimize spurs.

fields.name: PFD_DLY_SEL
fields.description: The PFD_DLY_SEL must be adjusted in accordance to the Ndivider value. This is with the functional description for the Ndivider

fields.name: PLL_DEN[31:16]
fields.description: The fractional denominator

fields.name: PLL_DEN[15:0]
fields.description: The fractional denominator

fields.name: MASH_SEED[31:16]
fields.description: The initial state of the MASH engine first accumulator. Can be used to shift phase or optimize fractional spurs. Every time the field is programmed, it ADDS this MASH seed to the existing one. To reset it, use the MASH_RESET_N bit.

fields.name: MASH_SEED[15:0]
fields.description: The initial state of the MASH engine first accumulator. Can be used to shift phase or optimize fractional spurs. Every time the field is programmed, it ADDS this MASH seed to the existing one. To reset it, use the MASH_RESET_N bit.

fields.name: PLL_NUM[31:16]
fields.description: The fractional numerator

fields.name: PLL_NUM[15:0]
fields.description: The fractional numerator

fields.name: OUTA_PWR
fields.description: Adjusts output power. Higher numbers give more output power to a point, depending on the pullup component used.

fields.name: OUTB_PD
fields.description: Powers down output B

fields.name: OUTA_PD
fields.description: Powers down output A

fields.name: MASH_RESET_N
fields.description: Resets MASH circuitry to an initial state

values.name: RESET
values.description: MASH held in reset. All fractions are ignored

values.name: ENABLED
values.description: Fractional mode enabled. MASH is NOT held in reset.

fields.name: MASH_ORDER
fields.description: Sets the MASH order

fields.name: OUTA_MUX
fields.description: Selects what signal goes to RFoutA

fields.name: OUT_ISET
fields.description: Setting to a lower value allows slightly higher output power at higher frequencies at the expense of higher current consumption. 0: Maximum power boost, 3: No output power boost.

fields.name: OUTB_PWR
fields.description: Output power setting for RFoutB

fields.name: OUTB_MUX
fields.description: Selects what signal goes to RFoutB

fields.name: INPIN_IGNORE
fields.description: Ignore SYNC and SysRefReq Pins

values.name: NORMAL_OPERATION
values.description: Pins are used. Only valid for VCO_PHASE_SYNC = 1

fields.name: INPIN_HYST
fields.description: High Hysteresis for LVDS mode

fields.name: INPIN_LVL
fields.description: Sets bias level for LVDS mode. In LVDS mode, a voltage divider can be inserted to reduce susceptibility to common-mode noise of an LVDS line because the input is single-ended. With a reasonable setup, TI recommends using INPIN_LVL = 1 (Vin) to use the entire signal swing of an LVDS line.

fields.name: INPIN_FMT
fields.description: IO Standard to be used for SYNC and SysRefReq pins.

values.name: SYNC_LVDS_SYSREFREQ_CMOS
values.description: Use LVDS for SYNC and CMOS for SysRefReq.

values.name: SYNC_CMOS_SYSREFREQ_LVDS
values.description: Use CMOS for SYNC and LVDS for SysRefReq.

fields.name: LD_TYPE
fields.description: Lock detect type

values.name: VCO_CAL_STATUS_AND_INDIRECT_VTUNE
values.description: VCO calibration status and Indirect Vtune

fields.name: LD_DLY
fields.description: Lock Detect Delay. This is the delay added to the lock detect after the VCO calibration is successful and before the lock detect is asserted high. The delay added is in phase-detector cycles. If set to 0, the lock detect immediately becomes high after the VCO calibration is successful.

fields.name: MASH_RST_COUNT[31:16]
fields.description: If the designer does not use this device in fractional mode with VCO_PHASE_SYNC = 1, then this field can be set to 0. In phase-sync mode with fractions, this bit is used so that there is a delay for the VCO divider after the MASH is reset. This delay must be set to greater than the lock time of the PLL. It does impact the latency time of the SYNC feature.

fields.name: MASH_RST_COUNT[15:0]
fields.description: If the designer does not use this device in fractional mode with VCO_PHASE_SYNC = 1, then this field can be set to 0. In phase-sync mode with fractions, this bit is used so that there is a delay for the VCO divider after the MASH is reset. This delay must be set to greater than the lock time of the PLL. It does impact the latency time of the SYNC feature.

fields.name: SYSREF_DIV_PRE
fields.description: Pre-divider for SYSREF

fields.name: SYSREF_PULSE
fields.description: Enable pulser mode in master mode

fields.name: SYSREF_EN
fields.description: Enable SYSREF

fields.name: SYSREF_REPEAT
fields.description: Enable repeater mode

fields.name: SYSREF_DIV
fields.description: Divider for the SYSREF. Actual divider value = regValue * 2 + 4

fields.name: JESD_DAC2_CTRL
fields.description: These are the adjustments for the delay for the SYSREF. Two of these must be zero and the other two values must sum to 63.

fields.name: JESD_DAC1_CTRL
fields.description: These are the adjustments for the delay for the SYSREF. Two of these must be zero and the other two values must sum to 63.

fields.name: SYSREF_PULSE_CNT
fields.description: Number of pulses in pulse mode in master mode

fields.name: JESD_DAC4_CTRL
fields.description: These are the adjustments for the delay for the SYSREF. Two of these must be zero and the other two values must sum to 63.

fields.name: JESD_DAC3_CTRL
fields.description: These are the adjustments for the delay for the SYSREF. Two of these must be zero and the other two values must sum to 63.

fields.name: RAMP_THRESH[32:32]
fields.description: This sets how much the ramp can change the VCO frequency before calibrating. If this frequency is chosen to be Δf, then it is calculated as follows: RAMP_THRESH = (Δf / fPD) × 16777216

fields.name: QUICK_RECAL_EN
fields.description: Causes the initial VCO_CORE, VCO_CAPCTRL, and VCO_DACISET to be based on the last value. Useful if the frequency change is small, as is often the case for ramping.

fields.name: VCO_CAPCTRL_STRT
fields.description: This sets the initial value for VCO_CAPCTRL if not overridden by other settings. Smaller values yield a higher frequency band within a VCO core. Valid number range is 0 to 183.

fields.name: RAMP_THRESH[31:16]
fields.description: This sets how much the ramp can change the VCO frequency before calibrating. If this frequency is chosen to be Δf, then it is calculated as follows: RAMP_THRESH = (Δf / fPD) × 16777216

fields.name: RAMP_THRESH[15:0]
fields.description: This sets how much the ramp can change the VCO frequency before calibrating. If this frequency is chosen to be Δf, then it is calculated as follows: RAMP_THRESH = (Δf / fPD) × 16777216

fields.name: RAMP_LIMIT_HIGH[32:32]
fields.description: This sets a maximum frequency that the ramp can not exceed so that the VCO does not get set beyond a valid frequency range. Suppose fHIGH is this frequency and fVCO is the starting VCO frequency then: For fHIGH ≥ fVCO: RAMP_LIMIT_HIGH = (fHIGH – fVCO)/fPD × 16777216 For fHIGH < fVCO this is not a valid condition to choose

fields.name: RAMP_LIMIT_HIGH[31:16]
fields.description: This sets a maximum frequency that the ramp can not exceed so that the VCO does not get set beyond a valid frequency range. Suppose fHIGH is this frequency and fVCO is the starting VCO frequency then: For fHIGH ≥ fVCO: RAMP_LIMIT_HIGH = (fHIGH – fVCO)/fPD × 16777216 For fHIGH < fVCO this is not a valid condition to choose

fields.name: RAMP_LIMIT_HIGH[15:0]
fields.description: This sets a maximum frequency that the ramp can not exceed so that the VCO does not get set beyond a valid frequency range. Suppose fHIGH is this frequency and fVCO is the starting VCO frequency then: For fHIGH ≥ fVCO: RAMP_LIMIT_HIGH = (fHIGH – fVCO)/fPD × 16777216 For fHIGH < fVCO this is not a valid condition to choose

fields.name: RAMP_LIMIT_LOW[32:32]
fields.description: This sets a minimum frequency that the ramp can not exceed so that the VCO does not get set beyond a valid frequency range. Suppose fLOW is this frequency and fVCO is the starting VCO frequency then: For fLOW ≤ fVCO: RAMP_LIMIT_LOW = 2 33 – 16777216 x (fVCO – fLOW) / fPD For fLOW > fVCO, this is not a valid condition to choose.

fields.name: RAMP_LIMIT_LOW[31:16]
fields.description: This sets a minimum frequency that the ramp can not exceed so that the VCO does not get set beyond a valid frequency range. Suppose fLOW is this frequency and fVCO is the starting VCO frequency then: For fLOW ≤ fVCO: RAMP_LIMIT_LOW = 2 33 – 16777216 x (fVCO – fLOW) / fPD For fLOW > fVCO, this is not a valid condition to choose.

fields.name: RAMP_LIMIT_LOW[15:0]
fields.description: This sets a minimum frequency that the ramp can not exceed so that the VCO does not get set beyond a valid frequency range. Suppose fLOW is this frequency and fVCO is the starting VCO frequency then: For fLOW ≤ fVCO: RAMP_LIMIT_LOW = 2 33 – 16777216 x (fVCO – fLOW) / fPD For fLOW > fVCO, this is not a valid condition to choose.

fields.name: RAMP_BURST_EN
fields.description: Enables burst ramping mode. In this mode, a RAMP_BURST_COUNT ramps are sent out when RAMP_EN is set from 0 to 1.

fields.name: RAMP_BURST_COUNT
fields.description: Sets how many ramps are run in burst ramping mode

fields.name: RAMP0_RST
fields.description: Resets RAMP0 at start of ramp to eliminate round-off errors. Must only be used in automatic ramping mode.

fields.name: RAMP_TRIGB
fields.description: Multipurpose trigger B definition

fields.name: RAMP_TRIGA
fields.description: Multipurpose Trigger A definition

fields.name: RAMP_BURST_TRIG
fields.description: Ramp burst trigger definition that triggers the next ramp in the count. Note that RAMP_EN starts the count, not this word.

fields.name: RAMP0_INC[29:16]
fields.description: 2's complement of the amount the RAMP0 is incremented in phase detector cycles.

fields.name: RAMP0_DLY
fields.description: Enabling this bit uses two clocks instead of one to clock the ramp. Effectively doubling the length.

fields.name: RAMP0_INC[15:0]
fields.description: 2's complement of the amount the RAMP0 is incremented in phase detector cycles.

fields.name: RAMP0_LEN
fields.description: Length of RAMP0 in phase detector cycles

fields.name: RAMP1_DLY
fields.description: Enabling this bit uses two clocks instead of one to clock the ramp. Effectively doubling the length.

fields.name: RAMP1_RST
fields.description: Resets RAMP1 to eliminate rounding errors. Must be used in automatic ramping mode.

fields.name: RAMP0_NEXT
fields.description: Defines what ramp comes after RAMP0

fields.name: RAMP0_NEXT_TRIG
fields.description: Defines what triggers the next ramp

fields.name: RAMP1_INC[29:16]
fields.description: 2's complement of the amount the RAMP1 is incremented in phase detector cycles

fields.name: RAMP1_INC[15:0]
fields.description: 2's complement of the amount the RAMP1 is incremented in phase detector cycles

fields.name: RAMP1_LEN
fields.description: Length of RAMP1 in phase detector cycles

fields.name: RAMP_DLY_CNT
fields.description: This is the number of state machine clock cycles for the VCO calibration in automatic mode. If the VCO calibration is less, then it is this time. If it is more, then the time is the VCO calibration time.

fields.name: RAMP_MANUAL
fields.description: Enables manual ramping mode, or otherwise automatic mode

fields.name: RAMP1_NEXT
fields.description: Determines what ramp comes after RAMP1

fields.name: RAMP1_NEXT_TRIG
fields.description: Defines what triggers the next ramp

fields.name: RAMP_TRIG_CAL
fields.description: Enabling this bit forces the VCO to calibrate after the ramp.

fields.name: RAMP_SCALE_COUNT
fields.description: Multiplies RAMP_DLY count by 2^RAMP_SCALE_COUNT

fields.name: rb_LD_VTUNE
fields.description: Readback of Vtune lock detect

fields.name: rb_VCO_SEL
fields.description: Reads back the actual VCO that the calibration has selected.

fields.name: rb_VCO_CAPCTRL
fields.description: Reads back the actual CAPCTRL capcode value the VCO calibration has chosen.

fields.name: rb_VCO_DACISET
fields.description: Reads back the actual amplitude (DACISET) value that the VCO calibration has chosen.
